records.title: Errors and Solutions Document
records.chunk: This page consists of a excel sheet which contains various types of errors encountered and their solutions

records.title: Charts
records.chunk:
ERROR
CAUSE
REMEDY
SUGGESTIONS
There only appears to be one scenario in the production area (and you are in it). Therefore, there are no comparison scenarios available at this time.
Only one scenario is present in production area.
More than one scenarios must be present in the production area to use the Compare Functionality.

Please supply some sort of description for this bookmark. This description will help you to distinguish between your other bookmarks.
This error is encountered when attempting  to bookmark a chart without any description.
Description must be provided when attempting to bookmark a chart.

A bookmark has already been defined. Please enter a unique bookmark description.
The description used while creating a bookmark already exists.
The description used while creating bookmark must be unique.

records.title: MLP
records.chunk:
ERROR
CAUSE
REMEDY
SUGGESTIONS
This screen is only available for planning-only processes. Contact Optessa Support for more information
Run Planner Screen was opened in Sequencing/Scheduling Mode.
Run Planner Screen must be opened only in Planning Mode.

No Bin Planning solution available. Please review your constraints.
1.Hard Constraints are getting violated.
2.There is not enough capacity to satisfy the demand.
1.Ensure that hard constraints are not violated.
2.Ensure that there is enough capacity to fulfill the demand.

records.title: Scenario
records.chunk:
ERROR
CAUSE
REMEDY
SUGGESTIONS
This scenario is currently marked as DO NOT DELETE. If you want to be able to archive this scenario please go to the scenario management screen and uncheck DO NOT DELETE.
The scenario that user is trying to delete has Do not Delete Ticked.
The scenario that user is trying to delete must not have Do not Delete Checkbox Ticked.

This scenario is currently marked as LOCKED. If you want to be able to archive this scenario please go to the scenario management screen and uncheck LOCK.
The scenario that the user is trying to delete is locked.
The scenario that the user is trying to delete must not be locked.

Permission denied when attempting to delete a base scenario. Please ensure you have base scenario delete permissions and try again.
The user group assigned to user is not assigned the production area in which the scenario is present.
The user group assigned to user must have the access to the production area in which the scenario is present.

records.title: Scenario
records.chunk:
Permission denied when attempting to delete scenario. Please ensure you have edit permissions in this production area and this scenario is not locked.
The user group assigned to user is not assigned the production area in which the scenario is present.
The user group assigned to user does not have the access to the production area in which the scenario is present.

Permission denied when attempting to edit scenario. Please ensure that you have edit permissions in this production area and this scenario is not locked.
The user group assigned to user is not assigned the production area in which the scenario is present.
The user group assigned to user must have the production area assigned in which the scenario is present.

The scenario cannot be saved as the length of notes is greater than 4000 characters. Please enter notes less than 4000 characters.
The scenario note length is greater than 4000 characters
The scenario note length must be less than 4000 characters

records.title: Scenario
records.chunk:
This scenario is the current scenario for the following users {0}, so it cannot be deleted.
The scenario that user is trying to delete is in use by some other user..
The scenario that user is trying to delete must not be in use by some other user.

This scenario cannot be deleted as it is the last scenario available in this production area.
The scenario was the last scenario that was available in the production area.
There must be atlest one scenario available in the production area

Permission denied when attempting to lock/unlock scenario. Please ensure you have scenario locking permissions in this production area and try again.
The user group assigned to user is not assigned the production area in which the scenario is present.
The user group assigned to user must have the production area assigned in which the scenario is present.

records.title: Scenario
records.chunk:
This scenario is currently marked as DO NOT DELETE. If you want to be able to delete this scenario please go to the scenario management screen and uncheck DO NOT DELETE.
The scenario that user is trying to delete has Do not Delete checkbox ticked.
The scenario that user is trying to delete must not have Do not Delete checkbox ticked.

Scenario name is already in use in this production area.
Scenario with same name already exist in the production area.
Scenario must have unique name within a production area.

Scenario names cannot contain special characters. (: * ? < > | # / \\ ' ")
Special characters used in the scenario name.
Scenario Name cannot have special characters except “_".

Scenario names cannot be blank.
Scenario name is blank
Scenario names cannot be blank.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
:note:atlassian-note#EAE6FF
Suggestions column gives some options regarding the wording of the error message so that it appears a bit more specific. This column needs to be deleted later before giving the access to the clients.
 Location of the menus may vary by model based on custom requirements. 
ERROR
CAUSE
REMEDY
SUGGESTIONS
Reviewed
Comment1
Duplicate attribute kit/kit value combination. Please select a different kit value or attribute kit.
Same demand attribute kit is used to define  multiple 'build ahead rules'
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>collate demand>order inflation>build-ahead-quantities.
- 
Define only one build ahead rule using a particular demand attribute kit

2
Duplicate attribute kit/kit value combination. Please select a different kit value or attribute kit.
Same demand attribute kit is used in two or more 'consumption rules'
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>collate demand>advanced collation settings>demand consumption.
- 
Define only one consumption rule using a particular demand attribute kit.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
3
Consume Interval must be greater than zero.
Null/ zero value entered for consume interval of consumption explosion rule under advanced collate settings.
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>collate demand>advanced collation settings>demand consumption. 
- 
Go to the consumption explosion-rule and change the consumption interval from zero to some natural number.
- 
Click "Apply and Return to Demand Collation".

4
Consume Quantity must be greater than zero.
The value in 'consume' section is set to 0 in 'Consumption Explosion Rules'.
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>collate demand>advanced collation settings>demand consumption. 
- 
Add a consumption explosion-rule and set consume quantity to any number greater than 0.
- 
Click "Collate Demand Now".

5
Data Missing: The demand kits for this scenario need to be evaluated to proceed. Please evaluate the demand kits and try again.
The newly defined demand attribute kits were not evaluated
- 
Go to options>attribute kits>demand attribute kits. 
- 
Define new demand attribute kit, save and evaluate the kit. 
- 
Click "Collate Demand Now".

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
6
The build quantity must be greater than or equal to 1.
Null/ zero value was set for build quantity for build ahead quantities rule.
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>collate demand>Order inflation>Build-Ahead Quantities 
- 
Add a Build-Ahead consumption explosion-rule and set build quantity to any number greater than 0.
- 
Click "Collate Demand Now".

7
The multiple of must be greater than or equal to 1.
The value entered for 'the multiple of' section is 0
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>collate demand>order inflation>order quantities by multiple. 
- 
The value of  Inflate demand “into multiples of”must be greater than 0.
- 
Click "Collate Demand Now".

8
The scrap factor must be greater than 1 and less than 100.
A value less than 1 or greater than 100 was used for scrap factor under Scrap Quantities rule
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>collate demand>Order inflation>Scrap Quantities 
- 
Add a Scrap Quantities rule and set scrap factor between 1 and 100.
- 
Click "Collate Demand Now".

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
9
Build down filters being applied to all kit values cannot be defined to create an Inventory Simulation constraint.
 Attribute kit  having 'All Values' selected is used to create 'Create Inventory Constraint'.
- 
Go to Scheduling > Collate Demand > Filter Demand > Build Down Filter,
- 
Select 'Create Inventory Constraint', select any specific value for the selected attribute kit instead of selecting 'All values'.
- 
Click "Collate Demand Now".

10
Duplicate attribute kit value combo found. An aggregation rule has already been defined for this attribute kit value combo.
The attribute kit value used for an aggregation rule is already  used in another aggregation rule.
- 
Go to scheduling>Define Lots>Finalize orders>Advanced Finalize settings, select Aggregation and Economic production quantity apply and return 
- 
Define only one aggregation rule using a particular attribute kit.
- 
Click "Finalize Orders Now".

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
11
Duplicate attribute kit found. This aggregation rules attribute kit is the same as a wild card aggregation rule.
The attribute kit used for this aggregation rule is already used in a wildcard aggregation rule.
- 
Go to scheduling>Define Lots>Finalize orders>Advanced Finalize settings, select Aggregation and Economic production quantity apply and return.
- 
Check the attribute kit used to define the aggregation rules. Duplicate attribute kit value combination are not allowed.
- 
Click "Finalize Orders Now".

12
There can only be one wild card aggregation rule.
More than one Wild Card aggregation rules were defined using same attribute kit.
- 
Go to Scheduling > Define Lots > Finalize Orders > Advanced Finalize Settings.
- 
 Define only one Wild Card aggregation rule for the same attribute kit.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
13
Duplicate kit found. This wild card aggregation rule has been defined for the same kit as another aggregation rule.
Two aggregation rules have been defined for the same attribute kit (one wild card).
- 
Go to Scheduling > Define Lots > Finalize Orders > Advanced Finalize Settings.
- 
 Select Aggregation and Economic production quantity, apply and return
- 
Define only one aggregation rule on a particular job attribute kit.

14
Duplicate attribute kit value combo found. This rule has already been defined.
Two or more Aggregation and EPQ rules are defined for the same attribute kit-value combination.
- 
Go to scheduling>Define Lots>Finalize orders>Advanced Finalize settings,
- 
 Select Aggregation and Economic production quantity, apply and return
- 
Max Aggregation and EPQ rule can be defined for a attribute kit-value combination.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
15
Duplicate attribute kit found. This rules attribute kit is the same as a wild card rule.
Two rules are defined using same attribute kit, one of the rule has a distinct value from the selected kit, while the other rule has 'All values' selected from the same attribute kit.
- 
Go to Scheduling > Define Lots > Finalize Orders > Define Aggregation and EPQ Rules.
- 
In 'Aggregation and EPQ Rules' define two or more rules each having different attribute kits.
- 
 In case same kit is selected, then none of them should have 'All values' selected.

16
Aggregation and economic production rules can only have one wild card definition each. (Remember, an aggregation rule with splitting will count as both).
Two Aggregation and economic production rules using wildcard are defined.
- 
Go to Scheduling > Define Lots > Finalize Orders > Define Aggregation and EPQ Rules.
- 
Define only one aggregation and EPQ rule using wildcard

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
17
Duplicate kit found. This wild card rule has been defined for the same kit as another rule.
The attribute kit used for this wild card aggregation and EPQ rule is already used in another aggregation rule.
- 
Go to scheduling>Define Lots>Finalize orders>Advanced Finalize settings.
- 
Select Aggregation and Economic production quantity apply and return.
- 
Define only one Aggregation and EPQ on one particular attribute kit value.

18
The split quantity must be greater than zero.
The split quantity value in the EPQ rule is set to zero.
- 
Go to scheduling>Define Lots>Finalize orders>Advanced Finalize settings.
- 
Select Aggregation and Economic production quantity apply and return.
- 
In 'Aggregation and EPQ Rules', the split quantity value must be greater than 0.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
19
Duplicate attribute kit found. This economic production rules attribute kit is the same as a wild card economic production rule.
The attribute kit used for this EPQ rule is already used in a wildcard EPQ rule.
- 
Go to scheduling>Define Lots>Finalize orders>Advanced Finalize settings.
- 
Select Aggregation and Economic production quantity apply and return
- 
Check if the attribute kit used to define this EPQ rule for any duplicate attribute kit-value combination.

20
There can only be one wild card economic production rule.
Two EPQ wildcard rules have been defined for the same attribute kit.
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in 'Finalize' UI. 
-Define only one EPQ wildcard rule using a particular job attribute kit.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
21
Duplicate kit found. This wild card economic production rule has been defined for the same kit as another economic production rule.
Two EPQ rules have been defined for the same attribute kit (one wild card).
- 
Go to scheduling>Define Lots>Finalize orders>Advanced Finalize settings.
- 
Select Aggregation and Economic production quantity apply and return.
- 
Define only one EPQ rule on one particular job attribute kit'

22
There is no capacity template defined for lines in this area, please try to generate capacity.
Generate Capacity Template, has not been run before finalize
- 
Go to Scheduling > Capacity > Generate Capacity Template.
- 
Run "Generate Capacity Template" (Scheduling -> Capacity) then run Finalize.

23
Comparison locks are not currently supported in Virtual Flow Line production areas.
Bias Sequence Locks are selected in Finalize Orders > Define Locks, using Create Jobs column checks in VFL area.
- 
Go to Scheduling > Define Lots > Finalize Orders > Define Locks. 
- 
Deactivate the 'Create Jobs' column checks since Bias Locks are not supported in VFL area.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
24
Not all sales orders could be exploded into operations for scheduling. Please review your routing definitions or contact Optessa Support for additional assistance.
No operations have been added for the routing that is assigned
- 
Go to options>parts and routings>routings.
- 
Assign atleast one operation to a routing before finalizing.

25
The selected finalize mode is not currently supported in Virtual Flow Line production areas.
GFL Batching engine is selected in advanced finalize settings
- 
GFL finalize mode is not supported currently in VFL production area. 
- 
Please use Standard Processing Or Aggregation and Economic Production Quantity finalize modes.

26
Variable lot size processing is not currently supported in Virtual Flow Line production areas. Please use fixed lot sizes.
Variable Lots is selected under Advanced Finalize Settings.
- 
Go to Define Lots > Finalize Orders > Advanced Finalize Settings. 
- 
Deselect the Variable Lots and select Fixed Lots.
- 
Run Finalize again.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
27
PP lot locks are not currently supported in Virtual Flow Line production areas.
A PPLot is defined in the VFL zone.
- 
Go to admin>troubleshooting>open table>PPLots
- 
Delete the existing PPLot as it must not be defined in a VFL zone.

28
Bin type {0} will generate {1} bins which exceeds the configured maximum of {2}. Please review the bin type definitions.
The Bin type {0} generates {1} bins, which exceeds configured max of {2}.
- 
Set a higher value to "MaxUnitCountBins" (Administration -> System settings -> MLS Properties)
- 
Increase the Unit count in non standard bin such that "max slot size inslots divided by active non stad unit count is greater than the MaxUnitCountBins (i.e 1000)"

29
A production area must be specified for each external data source.
Production area is not specified in External Data sources definition.
- 
Go to Scheduling > Import > Import Requirements > Advanced Import Settings > External Sources. 
- 
Specify the Production area name.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
30
A label must be specified for each external data source.
Label is not specified in External Data sources definition.
- 
Go to Scheduling > Import > Import Requirements > Advanced Import Settings > External Sources.
- 
Specify a label name.

31
Each external data source label must be unique.
Two or more external data sources definitions have same source label.
- 
Go to to Scheduling -> Imports -> Import Requirement -> Advanced Import Settings -> External Sources
- 
Give a unique source label to each external data sources defined.

32
A plant must be specified for each external data source.
Plant is not specified in External Data sources definition.
- 
Go to Scheduling > Import > Import Requirements > Advanced Import Settings > External Sources.
- 
Specify a plant name.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
33
Duplicate feature code mapping. You cannot map multiple feature sources to the same feature code. Please select a different feature to map to.
Same feature code is used to map multiple feature sources in Feature code Transfer rules.
- 
Go to Scheduling -> Imports -> Import Requirement -> Advanced Import Settings -> Feature Transfer 
- 
Select unique feature code to map to each feature transfer rule.

34
Attribute Kit missing. Please select an attribute kit for this date lag condition.
A Demand attribute kit which was used in Order Date Lags in Collate was deleted later before Collating again.
- 
Go to Collate > Advanced Collation Settings > Order Date Lags. 
- 
Select a new attribute kit or create the attribute kit which was deleted from the Date lag again.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
35
Duplicate attribute kit/kit value combination. Please select a different kit value or attribute kit.
Two order date lags have been defined on the same demand attribute kit.
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>collate demand>advanced collation setting> order date lags. 
- 
Define only 1 order date lag on one particular attribute kit. Delete if any duplicates are found

36
Attribute Kit Value missing. Please select an attribute kit value for this date lag condition.
Demand Attribute kits are missing/ deleted from the scenario.
- 
Navigate to Scheduling -> Collate Demand -> Collate Demand -> Advanced Collation Settings -> Order Date Lags 
- 
Only use the evaluated demand kits to define date lag condition.

37
StartDateLagAmount value must be greater than or equal to zero.
The start date lag amount value is set to null.
- 
Go to scheduling>collate>collate demand>advanced collation settings>order date lags. 
- 
Set the start date lag amount value such that it is greater than or equal to zero.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
38
DueDateLagAmount value must be greater than or equal to zero.
The due date lag amount value is set to null.
- 
Go to scheduling>collate>collate demand>advanced collation settings>order date lags. 
- 
Set the due date lag amount value such that it is greater than or equal to zero.

39
Start date lag amount must be greater than or equal to due date lag amount.
Start date lag amount entered in date lag condition is lower than due date lag amount.
- 
Go to scheduling>collate>collate demand>advanced collation settings>order date lags. 
- 
Set the start date lag amount value such that it is greater than due date lag.

40
The auto horizon end offset should be greater than zero.
The auto horizon end value is set to 0.
- 
Go to scheduling>imports>import requirements>advanced import parameters>other settings.
- 
Set the auto horizon end value greater than 0.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
41
No import defined. Please select a valid import from the defined imports.
The import definition initially selected in Import Sources was later deleted from Import mappings and now import sources are not able to find another definition to select.
- 
Go to Administration > Imports/Exports > Imports. 
- 
Define 1 or more import definitions and add the details to map the import files systematically. 
- 
Select these imports in the Scheduling > Imports > Import Requirements > Import Sources > Advanced Import Settings > Import Sources.

42
Duplicate import definition. You cannot define the same import more than once per Production Area/Process. Please select a new import.
Multiple Imports have been defined for the same import definition.
- 
Go to scheduling>imports>import requirements>advanced import parameters>import sources. 
- 
Define only oe import using one particular import definitions.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
43
No table-based import defined. Please select a valid import from the defined imports.
No Table- based import defined/ Table-based imports got deleted/missing.
Define a table-based import (Administration -> Imports/Exports -> Table to Table Imports). Select this table-based import in "Import sources, Define this Production Area's Table-Based Import Sources and Order of Execution" (Scheduling -> Import Requirements -> Advanced Import Settings -> Import sources)

44
Duplicate table-based import definition. You cannot define the same import more than once per Production Area/Process. Please select a new import.
Same table-based import was selected more than once in Import sources under 'Define this Production Area's Table-Based Import Sources and Order of Execution'.
Either select a table-based import only once in Scheduling > Import Requirements > Import sources > 'Define this Production Area's Table-Based Import Sources and Order of Execution' or create a new Import definition in Administration > Imports/Exports > Table-to-Table Imports to select a second import source.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
45
The horizon end datetime must be greater than the horizon start date time.
The horizon end datetime is set less than the horizon start datetime.
- 
Navigate to Scheduling -> Imports -> Import Requirements
- 
Set horizon end datetime greater than the horizon start datetime.
- 
Click on Import Now.

46
The consumption start datetime must be equal to or less than the horizon start datetime.
The consumption start datetime is set greater than horizon start datetime.
- 
Navigate to Scheduling -> Imports -> Import Requirements 
- 
Set consumption star datetime equal to or less than the horizon start datetime.
- 
Click on Import Now.

47
The consumption end datetime must be equal to or greater than the horizon end datetime.
The consumption end datetime is set less than horizon end datetime.
- 
Navigate to Scheduling -> Imports -> Import Requirements 
- 
Set consumption end datetime equal to or greater than the horizon end datetime.
- 
Click on Import Now.

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
48
This demand filter has the same attributekit and attributekitvalue as another demand filter. No Demand filters can share the same attributekit and attributekitvalue.
Multiple demand by date rules have been defined on the same demand attribute kit and attribute kits value.
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>filter demand>demand by date.
- 
Define only one demand by date rule in filter demands on one particular attribute kit value.
- 
Click on 'collate demand now'

49
The gross inventory must be greater than or equal to zero.
The gross starting inventory value is set to zero in build down filter definition.
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>filter demand>build down filter.
- 
The gross starting inventory value should be greater than zero(and greater than build down quantity).
- 
Click on 'collate demand now'

records.title: GFL
records.chunk:
50
The gross inventory must be greater than or equal to the quantity.
The gross starting inventory value is less than gross starting inventory.
- 
Go to scheduling>collate demand>filter demand>build down filter.
- 
The gross starting inverntory value must be set greater than or equal to the build down quantity. 
- 
Click on 'collate demand now'

51

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
:note:atlassian-note#EAE6FF
Suggestions column gives some options regarding the wording of the error message so that it appears a bit more specific. This column needs to be deleted later before giving the access to the clients.
 Location of the menus may vary by model based on custom requirements. 
ERROR
CAUSE
REMEDY
SUGGESTIONS
Reviewed
Comment1
The scenario is configured for {0} simultaneous runs while a maximum of {1} runs has been set by the system administrator. Please lower the scenario setting to comply with the defined maximum.
For this error to occur, there must be a scenario property 'MaxParallelRun' under Scenario settings and properties table. Error caused when the value of 'MaxParallelRun' is set to a lower than the value compared to Number of simultaneous runs in the Run Schedule UI. (Run Schedule > Advanced Settings)
- 
Go to Scenario Configuration menu (Options > Scenario Settings > Scenario Configuration )
- 
  Check the value of scenario property ‘MaxParallelRun’.
- 
  Set its value greater than or equal to the value of Number of simultaneous runs in Run Scheduling UI. (Run schedule > Advanced settings).

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
YES

2
The following shift details are overlapping other shift details: {SHIFT_NAME}. Please fix the overlapping shifts and try again.
This error occurs when one of the shift definition {SHIFT_NAME} has overlapping time interval because of which the capacity cannot be generated.
- 
Go to Options > Capacity Master > Define Shift Patterns.
- 
Check if any record of the shift details has time definition that overlaps the time definition of another shift details record of that shift definition.
- 
Re-define the Shifts details and make sure there are no time overlaps.
Overlapping time intervals found in the shift details {SHIFT_NAME}. Please fix the overlapping shifts and try again.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
3
The shift patterns:{SHIFT_NAME}
are no longer available. Please adjust the Shift Pattern assigned to your lines via the Line
This error will occur when the shift pattern assigned to the line under production area & line configuration is deleted/missing from shift patterns & shift pattern details.
- 
Go to Options > Capacity Master > Define Shift Patterns.
- 
Define a new Shift Definition with the same name as the one assigned to the line in ‘Production Area and Line Configuration’.
OR 
- 
Define a new Shift Definition with a unique name and assign it to the respective line in ‘Production Area and Line Configuration’.
The shifts assigned to the line:{SHIFT_NAME}
are no longer available. Please adjust the holiday definition assigned to your lines.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
4
The holiday set assigned to lines: {HOLIDAY_SET_NAME}
are no longer available. Please adjust the line holiday set assignment via the Line Configuration tool (Options > Line Settings > Line Configuration).
This error occurs when the Holiday Set assigned to the line under production area & line configuration is deleted/missing from Holiday set & Holiday set details.
- 
Go to Options > Capacity Master > Define Holidays.
- 
Define a new Holiday Set with the same name as the one assigned to the line in ‘Production Area and Line Configuration’.
OR 
- 
Define a new Holiday Set with a unique name and assign it to the respective line in ‘Production Area and Line Configuration’. 
The holidays assigned to the line:{HOLIDAY_NAME}
are no longer available. Please adjust the holiday definition assigned to your lines.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
5
The scenario process {0} is in conflict with already running {1}. Try again later.
This error occurs when two conflicting processes are running at the same time. Some of the processes(consider processA) which when initiated follows a particular chain of processes (which includes say  processB). The said error will be thrown when both these process (processA and processB) are run simultaeneously. 
When this error is thrown,
- 
Wait for all the process in the background to finish. 
- 
Run the required process after all the previous processes are concluded. 
For example; such error is likely to occur when Finalize Orders and Evaluate Kits function is triggered simultaneously.

YES

6
Commit could not be performed - scenario is locked for sequencing.
This error occurs when the scenario is locked and user tries to perform Commit.
- 
Go to Manage Scenarios screen by clicking on the Breadcrumb trail.
- 
Unlock the scenario in which Commit must be performed.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
7
The constraint name {0} is already being used in this scenario. Please provide a unique constraint name.
This error occurs when a user is defining a new constraint but the constraints name given is already in use.
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in ‘define constraint’ UI (it could be any constraint).
- 
Give a unique constraint name and then save.

YES

8
An attribute kit is already using the name {0}. Constraints and attribute kits cannot share the same names. Please adjust the constraint name accordingly so that it does not violate this rule.
This error occurs when a user is defining a new constraint but the specified constraint name is already being used by another attribute kit.
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in ‘define constraint’ UI.
- 
Give the constraint a unique name and then save it.

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
YES
9
maxQty must be less than or equal to the window size
This error is thrown when a user is trying to define a Sliding Window Constraint but the MaxQty specified for the constraint is greater than the window size.
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in ‘Sliding Window Constraint’ UI.
- 
The ‘MaxQty’ value specified in the constraint must be less than or equal to the window size mentioned.

YES

10
minQty must be less than or equal to the window size
This error is thrown when a user is trying to define a Sliding Window Constraint but the MinQty specified for the constraint is greater than the window size.
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in ‘Sliding Window Constraint’ UI.
- 
The ‘MinQty’ value specified in the constraint must be less than or equal to the  window size mentioned.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
11
minQty must be less than or equal to maxQty
This error is thrown when a user is trying to define a new Sliding Window Constraint but the MinQty specified for the constraint is greater than the MaxQty.
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in ‘Sliding Window Constraint’ UI.
- 
The ‘MinQty’ value specified in the constraint must be less than or equal to the ‘MaxQty’ value.

YES

12
The selected attribute kit ({0}) does not appear to have been evaluated as there are no values assigned to it. You can either select a different attribute kit OR open another view tab, evaluate the attribute kits, return to this constraint screen and try again.
In a constraint where the user needs to select the 'attribute kit' along with the 'attribute kit value' and the selected attribute kit is not evaluated, this error is thrown at the time of saving the constraint.
- 
Open a new tab.
- 
Go to Options > attribute kits > evaluate job kits.
- 
Go back to constraint summary and define the required constraint again.

ON HOLD

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
Not reproducible13
The Attribute Kit Value has not been supplied. This is likely caused when the selected attribute kit ({0}) has not been evaluated and does not have any values attached to it. Please cancel your changes and make sure to Evaluate the Attribute Kits or Finalize.
In a constraint UI, where the user needs to select the 'attribute kit' along with the 'attribute kit value' and the selected attribute kit is not evaluated, this error is thrown at the time of saving the constraint.
- 
Open a new tab.
- 
Go to Options > attribute kits > evaluate job kits.
- 
Go back to constraint summary and define the required constraint again and save.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
14
The From Attribute Kit Value has not been supplied. This is likely caused when the selected attribute kit ({0}) has not been evaluated and does not have any values attached to it. Please cancel your changes and make sure to Evaluate the Attribute Kits
This error is thrown when the attribute kit that is being used in the ‘from attribute kit’ section in the constraint that is being defined is not evaluated and is simply saved.
- 
Open a new tab.
- 
Go to Options > attribute kits > evaluate job kits.
- 
Go back to constraint summary and define the required constraint again and save.

YES

15
The constraint {0} is defined to use an interval kit that produces non-numeric values. Please return to the Constraint Summary to locate and edit this constraint''s definition so that it uses an appropriate selection.
This error is shown when the Interval kit used in Precedence Interval Constraint returns non-numeric values.
Check the Interval kit used in Precedence interval constraint mentioned in the error message   and rectify the same. This kit must return only numeric values.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
16
The constraint {0} is defined to use a precedence kit that produces non-numeric values. Please return to the Constraint Summary to locate and edit this constraint's definition so that it uses an appropriate selection.
This error is shown when the Precedence kit used in the Precedence Interval Constraint returns non numeric values.
Check the Precedence kit used in Precedence interval constraint mentioned in the error message and rectify the same. This kit must return only numeric values.

YES

17
The constraint {0} is defined to use a quantity flag that produces non-numeric values. Please return to the Constraint Summary to locate and edit this constraint''s definition so that it uses an appropriate selection.
This error is shown when the attribute kit that is being used in the 'Quantity Type' section returns non-numeric values.
- 
Go to the constraint mention the error message.
- 
Select an appropriate attribute kit which returns numeric value in the ‘Quantity Type’ section.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
18
Distribution across ramping bins is not supported in multi-line mode, please choose a line kit that only considers one line or choose not to distribute the ramping volume.
This error is shown when the Line Kit defined under Topology/Process is comprising of two or more Lines. This Line Kit has been used in Ramping constraint while also keeping 'Distribute cross bins' option active.
- 
Go to Options > Topology/Process > Line Kits 
- 
Assign a single Line to the Line Kit
OR 
- 
Go to  Scheduling > constraint summary > ramping. 
- 
Deactivate ‘distribute across bins’ option.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
19
The constraint {0} is defined to use a holding time kit that produces non-numeric values. Please return to the Constraint Summary to locate and edit this constraint''s definition so that it uses an appropriate selection.
This error occurs when the ‘Holding time’ attribute kit selected in Resource Constraint UI is returning non numeric values.
- 
Check the job attribute kit used as holding time kit in resource utilization constraint mentioned in the error message. 
- 
Make necessary changes such that the kit returns desired numeric values.

YES

20
The constraint {0} is defined to use a start offset kit that produces non-numeric values. Please return to the Constraint Summary to locate and edit this constraint''s definition so that it uses an appropriate selection.
This error occurs when the ‘Offset Kit’ selected in Resource Utilization constraint returns non-numeric values.
- 
Check the Job Attribute Kit that is used as Offset kit in Resource Utilization constraint mentioned in the error message.
- 
Make necessary changes such that the kit returns desired numeric values.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
21
The constraint {0} is defined to use a per unit kit that produces non-numeric values. Please return to the Constraint Summary to locate and edit this constraint''s definition so that it uses an appropriate selection.
This error occurs when the "Qty per unit" kit in the Resource utilization constraint returns non-numeric values.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > constraint summary.
- 
Navigate to a constraint that is shown in the error message. 
- 
Check the Job Attribute Kit that is used as "Qty per unit" kit.
- 
Edit the kit to return numeric value as per requirement or create a new attribute kit that returns a numeric value and select this new kit for ‘Qty per unit’ kit.

YES

22
The constraint description must contain some text describing the constraints purpose.
This error is thrown when a user is defining a new constraint but the Constraint description is empty.
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in Constraint definition UI.
- 
Add a proper description to the constraint that is being defined and then save.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
23
A meaningful constraint name must be supplied.
This error is thrown when a user is defining a new constraint but the Constraint name is empty.
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in Constraint definition UI.
- 
Add a unique name to the constraint that is being defined and then save.

YES

24
The Cycle Begin Point value must be greater than zero.
This error is thrown when the cycle beginning point is set to 0 in cycles constraint.
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in Cycle Constraint definition UI.
- 
Enter the ‘cycle beginning point’ value greater than 0

YES

25
The window size must be greater than zero.
The window size is set as 0 in sliding window constraint definition.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Sliding Window Constraint
- 
Set window size to desired natural number.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
26
The constraint name contains invalid characters. (: * ? , <> | ; [] / \\ ' ")
This error occurs when the user is trying to define a new constraint but the constraint name given comprises of the special characters (: * ? , <> | ; [] / \\ ' ") while saving the constraint.
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in Constraint definition UI.
- 
Give a suitable name to the constraint which does not contain the special characters (: * ? , <> | ; [] / \\ ' ") and save the constraint.

YES

27
The minimum changes value must be less than or equal to the maximum changes value.
This error occurs when ‘Minimum Changes’ value is greater than ‘Maximum Changes’ in the Change Count Constraint. 
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in Change Count Constraint definition UI.
- 
In change count constraint, set the 'Maximum Changes' value in such a way that it is greater than the 'Minimum Changes' value.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
28
The min/max changes value can not be negative.
Negative values were entered in the sections of "Minimum Change" and/or "Maximum Change" in Sliding Change Count constraint. 
At the time of getting this error, the user is already in Constraint definition UI.
- 
Edit the values in the sections of Minimum Change and Maximum Change to values greater than or equal to 0.

ON HOLD

Not reproducible through UI.29
The minimum quantity value must be less than or equal to the maximum quantity value.
This error occurs when the minimum quantity specified is greater than the maximum quantity in the Run Length Constraint definition.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Run Length Constraint 
- 
Enter a valid range for the Quantity Acceptable, range defined from a smaller value to a greater value. The maximum quantity value must be greater than the minimum quantity value.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
30
The minimum tolerance value must be less than or equal to the maximum tolerance value.
This error occurs when the 'Minimum Tolerance' value is greater than the 'Maximum Tolerance' value in the Bin Count Pattern Constraint definition.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Bin Count Constraint 
- 
Enter valid values. The 'Maximum  Tolerance' value must be greater than the 'Minimum Tolerance' value.

YES

31
The maximum inventory level must be greater than or equal to the minimum inventory level.
This error occurs when, the maximum inventory level is set lower than the minimum inventory level in the Inventory Simulation Constraint definition.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Inventory Simulation Constraint
- 
Set maximum inventory level higher than or equal to minimum inventory level as per requirements.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
32
There must be an underlying constraint selected.
This error occurs when  the underlying constraint is not defined/selected in the Meta Count Constraint definition.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Meta Count Constraint
- 
Select an appropriate constraint in the ‘Underlying Constraint’ section.

YES

33
The minimum meta count cannot be greater than the maximum meta count.
This error occurs when the Minimum Count value is greater than the Maximum Count value in the Meta Count Constraint definition.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Meta Count Constraint
- 
Set the Max Count value in such a way that it is greater than the Min Count value.

YES

34
The minimum meta count cannot be negative.
This error occurs when the value entered in the section "Min Count" is negative in the Meta Count Constraint definition.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Meta Count Constraint
- 
Enter any positive value ' in the column of "MINQTY". This value must be greater than or equal to 0

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
ON HOLD
Not reproducible through UI.35
The Seed Position value must be greater than zero.
This error occurs when the  Seed Position value has been defined as 0 while saving the Attribute Pattern constraint.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Attribute Pattern Constraint
- 
The Seed Position value must be greater than 0. Seed position value 1 indicates no seed and signifies that the pattern will be generated from the first position itself.

YES

36
The initial, final, minimum, and maximum inventory levels must be greater than or equal to zero.
This error is thrown when negative values are entered in the sections of Inventory Range and Inventory On-hand in standard limit mode.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > constraint summary > Inventory Simulation Constraint.
- 
Enter any value greater than or equal to '0' in the columns of LEVEL_MAX, LEVEL_MIN, LEVEL_INITIAL and LEVEL_FINAL. 
- 
Save the changes in the Constraint summary UI

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
ON HOLD
Not reproducible through UI.37
The maximum changes value must be greater than or equal to zero.
This error occurs when negative values entered as the maximum quantity in the Change count constraint UI, hence the error.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > constraint summary > Change Count
- 
Enter any value greater than or equal to '0' in the column of "MAXCHANGESPERBIN"

ON HOLD
Not reproducible through UI.38
The minimum changes value must be greater than or equal to zero.
This error occurs when a negative value is entered in the ‘minimum quantity’ section in the Change count constraint UI.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > constraint summary > Change Count
- 
Enter any value greater than or equal to '0' in the column of "MINCHANGESPERBIN".

ON HOLD
Not reproducible through UI.39
The minimum quantity value must be greater than or equal to zero.
This error occurs when negative value is entered in the 'minimum quantity' section in the Runlength constraint UI
- 
Go to  Scheduling > constraint summary > Runlength.
- 
Enter any value greater than or equal to '0' in the "MINQTY" section.

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
ON HOLD
Not reproducible through UI.40
Safety stock must be greater than or equal to zero.
This error occurs when a negative value is entered in the "Safety Stock" section of the Inventory Simulation Constraint UI.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > constraint summary > Inventory Simulation.
- 
Enter any value greater than or equal to '0' in the column of "LEVEL_FINAL"

ON HOLD
Not reproducible through UI.41
Number of bins must be greater than or equal to zero.
This error occurs when negative values entered in the "Number of Bins" section of the Inventory Simulation constraint UI.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > constraint summary > Inventory Simulation.
- 
Enter any value greater than or equal to '0' in the column of "TARGET_BIN_COUNT"

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
ON HOLD
Not reproducible through UI.42
The initial and maximum tolerance values must be greater than or equal to zero.
This error occurs when negative values entered in the "Inventory On-Hand" section of the Inventory Simulation constraint UI.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > constraint summary > Inventory Simulation.
- 
Enter any value greater than or equal to '0' in the columns of "LEVEL_INITIAL" and "LEVEL_FINAL"

ON HOLD
Not reproducible through UI.43
The Position Begin Point value must be greater than zero.
This error occurs when the Position Beginning Point value is set to 0 in the Cycles Constraint definition.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Cycles Constraint
- 
In Cycles constraint, Position Beginning Point must be set to a value greater than or equal to 1.

YES

44
The custom penalty policy parameter must be specified.
This error occurs when Custom penalty policy is opted but the value isn't specified in the constraint definition. 
Enter the custom penalty policy value after opting for 'custom penalty policy' in the constraint definition.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
45
The lower penalty weight value must be a positive real number that is greater than zero.
This error occurs when ‘Lower Penalty Weight’ was set to a negative number in the constraint definition UI.
Enter the lower penalty weight value greater than 0.

YES

46
The upper penalty weight value must be a positive real number that is greater than zero.
This error occurs when ‘Upper Penalty Weight’ was set to a negative number in the constraint definition UI.
Enter the upper penalty weight value greater than 0

YES

47
The minimum resource level cannot be greater than the maximum level.
This error occurs when Minimum Level value is set greater than the value of Maximum Level in the Resource Utilization constraint definition.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Resource Utilization Constraint
- 
Enter a Minimum Level value which is less than or equal to Maximum Level value.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
48
The penalty curve value must be greater than or equal to zero.
This error occurs when Penalty Curve value is set to ‘User Defined' and its assigned a negative value in the constraint definition definition UI.
Set the penalty curve value to any number greater than or equal to 0.

YES

49
When an attribute value is supplied, the step size value must be greater than one.
This error occurs when 'In increments of' value is entered as 0 in Run Length constraint.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Run Length Constraint
- 
The 'In increments of' must be set to a value greater than or equal to 1.

YES

50
The step size value must be greater than zero.
This error occurs when 'In increments of' value is entered as 0 in Feature Capacity constraint.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Feature Capacity Constraint
- 
The 'In increments of' must be set to a value greater than or equal to 1.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
51
The tolerance minus value cannot be negative.
This error occurs when negative value was entered in the lower tolerance limit in Bin Count Pattern.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Bin Count Pattern Constraint
- 
Enter tolerance value which is greater than or equal to zero

YES

52
The tolerance to value must be positive or zero.
This error occurs when negative values were entered in the tolerance range in the Cycle/Smoothing constraint definition.
- 
Go to  Scheduling > Constraints >  Constraint Summary > Cycles/Smoothing Constraint
- 
Remove the negative tolerance values. Enter values which is strictly greater than or equal to zero

YES

53
CSV delimiter should be a single character.
This error occurs when multiple delimiters are present in CSV file that is being imported.
- 
The CSV file should not have multiple delimiters.
- 
Import another appropriate file or make the required changes in the existing file.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
54
No valid optimization engine instances located - please contact Optessa support
This error occurs when the Engine/web app could be down or the Engine URL incorrectly configured in the ENG_URL table.
Check the ENG_URL table to see if the URL entry has been configured correctly.
If the URL is found to be correctly configured, contact the admin team to check if the engine servers are running or not.

YES

55
Excel file name is required
This error occurs when no file is selected while uploading the constraint details using excel import.
- 
Select an appropriate file containing the constraint details.
- 
Click on Import again.
No selection has been made. Please select an appropriate file.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
56
The feeder line you are trying to add already exists or has children that exist further up the tree.
This error occurs when the same area is selected for 'production area' as well as 'parent production area' in advanced import settings (advanced import settings > Parent area > Feeder Lines editor)
- 
Select appropriate 'production area' and 'parent production area' in feeder lines editor. 
- 
Two distinct areas must be specified.

ON HOLD
57
The feeder line and parent line cannot be the same.
This error occurs when the same area is selected for 'production area' as well as 'parent production area' in advanced import settings (advanced import settings > Parent area > Feeder Lines editor)
- 
Select appropriate 'production area' and 'parent production area' in feeder lines editor. 
- 
Two distinct areas must be specified.

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
ON HOLD
58
No valid filter values were found for the condition. Please enter some filter value(s) and try again
This error occurs when no condition is specified to choose the jobs in Schedule Review > Gantt Chart > Filter Gantt Chart.
- 
Go to Schedule Review > Gantt Chart > Filter Gantt Chart
- 
Select a condition to choose a certain jobs to view in Gantt Chart.
- 
Render chart

YES

59
The selected operator does not support multiple values. Please only provide one value or choose an operator that supports multiple values.
This error occurs when when multiple values are entered for a condition, the operator selected is improper in Schedule Review > Gantt Chart > Filter Gantt Chart.
In Schedule Review > Gantt Chart > Filter Gantt Chart, when multiple values are entered for a condition, the operator 'is in' should be selected.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
60
The GFL batching lotnumber setting {0} is not valid (must be either LOTNUMBER or a kit in the attributekit_demand table). Please adjust the scenario settings.
This error occurs when the ‘GFL_BATCHING_LOTNUMBER’ value in the ‘scenario configuration’ table is not set to ‘LOTNUMBER’ or any other valid existing attribute kit.
- 
Go to, 'settings & scenario properties' table
- 
Set the value of GFL_BATCHING_LOTNUMBER value to LOTNUMBER or any other valid existing attribute kit.

YES

61
The GFL batching lotqty setting {0} is not valid (must be either LOTQTY or a kit in the attributekit_demand table). Please adjust the scenario settings.
This error occurs when the ‘GFL_BATCHING_LOTQTY’ value is not set to LOTQTY or any other valid attribute kit in 'settings and scenario properties' table.
- 
Go to, 'settings & scenario properties' table
- 
Set the value of ‘GFL_BATCHING_LOTQTY’ value to ‘LOTQTY’ or any other valid attribute kit

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
62
The GFL batching scheme setting {0} is not valid (must be 1 or 2). Please adjust the scenario settings.
This error occurs when GFL batching scheme is set at value {0} (other than 1 or 2) in scenario properties.
- 
Go to options menu -> scenario settings -> scenario configuration -> child table.
- 
Change the GFL batching scheme value to 1 or 2

YES

63
The GFL batching lot sort kit {0} is not valid (must be a kit in the attributekit_demand table). Please adjust the scenario settings.
This error occurs when the ‘GFL_BATCHING_SORT_KIT' value is not set to any demand attribute kit in 'settings and scenario properties' table.
- 
Go to options menu -> scenario settings -> scenario configuration -> child table.
- 
Go to GFL_BATCHING_SORT_KIT and set its value to one of the demand attribute kit or '*' to define all the kits.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
64
Please configure the parameters for creating inventory constraints related to the active GFL build down filter conditions.
The Inventory Simulation constraints parameters were not configured in gfl_is_config table.
If the Build down filter is defined at collate, and the IS constraint flag is enabled, then Inventory Simulation constraint/s parameters must be configured in gfl_is_config table.

YES

65
The following Batching Run-Length constraints are set to active but are not using the correct GFL Attribute kit({0}): {1}. Please edit, disable, or delete these constraints before performing Finalize process again.
This error occurs when the active run length constraints {0} are not using the job attribute kit given to the GFL batching engine in advanced finalize settings.
Disable/delete this active run length constraints {0} or edit them to use the GFL attribute kit given to GFL batching engine in advanced finalize settings.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
Applicable under “GFL Batching Mode”66
The GFL batch kit {0}, was not found in the attributekit_demand table. Please correct your GFL Batch settings.
This error occurs when a demand attribute kit was selected, also to be used in Run Length constraint in Finalize under Finalize > Advanced Finalize settings > GFL Batching Engine. This kit was later deleted before finalizing again.
In Finalize > Advanced Finalize settings > GFL Batching Engine, select a non-deleted demand attribute kit or create a new kit as per requirement and select this kit in Run Length constraint definition in Finalize.

YES

Applicable under “GFL Batching Mode”67
"The GFL batch kit has not been set in the scenario settings"
This error occurs when the attribute kit used in batching constraint is not present in GFL_BATCHING table.
Under Finalize > GFL Batching, attribute kit used in GFL Batching Constraint should be defined in GFL_BATCHING Table.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
Applicable under “GFL Batching Mode”68
There are no GFL Batching constraint(s) defined, please define at least one constraint and try again.
This error occurs when no GFL batching constraint has been defined in the Finalize > batching constraints UI.
Define at least one GFL batching constraint under the Finalize > batching constraints UI.

YES

Applicable under “GFL Batching Mode”69
The lot size must be greater than or equal to 1.
This error occurs when the fixed-size lot quantity is set to zero under Finalize > standard finalize UI.
Under Finalize > standard finalize UI, the fixed-size lot quantity value must be set greater than or equal to 1.

YES

70
Part {0} is assigned to routing {1} which has no alternates defined for operation {2}
This error occurs when no value is defined under “alternate routes”  for an operation in VFL scenario.
Under Routings > Routing List, user must define a line-kit under “alternate routes” for operation in VFL.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
71
Invalid Scrap Factor: The scrap factor must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than 1.
This error occurs when scrap Factor was kept greater than 100%.
Under Collate Demand > Order Inflation > Scrap Quantities, define a rule with Scrap Factor less than 100%.

YES

72
Upload cannot proceed as the maximum uploaded data volume ({0}MB) would be exceeded: new upload volume = {1}MB, existing files = {2}MB.
This error occurs when the server doesn't have enough storage for the file being uploaded.
File size + disk space on the server should be less than or equal to value set under MLS Property MaxdatauploadMB.

YES

73
Scenario import files must be of type *.zip. The supplied file does not match this criteria and will not be uploaded to the server. Please supply a valid scenario import file.
This error occurs when at Zipped Scenario Import, a file not having '.zip' file extension was chosen to import.
In Options > Scenario Transfer > Import a Zipped Scenario, choose a file having '.zip' file extension to import.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
74
The plant labeled {0} does not exist in this model; therefore this scenario cannot be imported.
This error occurs when the plant label {0} doesn't exist in this model.
Check plant label in the zipped scenario file, if plant label {0} was deleted, a new plant with label {0} needs to be setup for importing this zip scenario.

YES

75
The scenario name specified {0}, already exists in the plant and production area that is being imported into. Please provide a non-blank, unique scenario name.
This error occurs when the exact same scenario file referring to the current scenario was chosen to import in (Options>Scenario Transfer>Import a Zipped Scenario).
In Options > Scenario Transfer > Import a Zipped Scenario, choose a scenario file which is different compared to the current scenario to import.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
Alternatively, the files can posses different data but the same name (eg: customer send updated scenario of a previously sent scenario)76
The scenario name specified is blank. Please provide a non-blank, unique scenario name.
This error occurs when the section 'scenario name' was left blank during the process of importing a zipped scenario.
Enter a unique scenario name in the 'scenario name' section and then import.

YES

77
The production area labeled {0} does not exist in the plant {1} of this model. For this reason, the scenario will not be imported.
This error occurs during the “Import Zip Scenario”, when the production area {0] doesn't exist in this plant {1}
While importing zip scenario, check production area label in the zipped scenario file, If production area label {0} was deleted or not existing in current plant {1} a new production area with label {0} needs to be setup in plant {1} for importing this zip scenario.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
78
Attribute kit cannot be named as {0} since it is a reserved system attribute.
This error occurs when the attribute Kit name entered is a reserved system attribute (LOTNUMBER, LOTQTY, LOTTIME, and so on)
Enter an attribute kit name which is different from the system reserved attribute kit names (LOTNUMBER, LOTQTY, LOTTIME, and so on)

YES

79
The line cannot be deleted as it is the only physical line defined in the current production area
This error occurs when only one line has been defined and the user tries to delete it.
Under Production Area/Line configuration, define a new line if the existing one needs to be deleted. Once the new line is set up, you may proceed with deleting the original line

YES

80
Login Failed - Invalid Username and/or Password, remember they are both case sensitive.
This error occurs when Incorrect username/ password is entered at Log in stage.
Enter correct username/ password on Log in. 
NOTE: Both are case sensitive.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
81
Your user account is locked, please contact your system administrator.
This error occurs when incorrect login password was entered 3 times and the account was locked.
Admin account can unlock the user from Administration > User Management > Users.
Alternatively, if the user is an admin; he/she can unlock their account from the respective model admin tool.

YES

82
An existing Optessa session already exists in another browser window. Please close all of your browser windows and then try to login again.
This error occurs when a model is already open in another tab of the same browser in which user is trying to open model.
- 
Use incognito mode to open same model if required.
- 
Reopen the browser or use another browser.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
83
Invalid matrix names {0} found in the excel sheet uploaded.
This error occurs when the name of the worksheet does not match with the name of the attribute kit used in Feature Combination constraint under Feature combination Matrix.
Under Feature combination Matrix, the name of the worksheet must match with the name of the attribute kit used in Feature Combination constraint before uploading the sheet.

YES

84
Successfully imported data from {0} worksheets.
Empty worksheet was uploaded.
Empty worksheet must not be uploaded. Upload a worksheet containing suitable data and then upload.

YES

This is not displayed as an error, rather as part of the dialogue box85
Symmetric matrix has different values for {1} - {0} and {0} - {1}. Only one of the values used.
In Feature Combination Matrix, a non Symmetric matrix was uploaded.
If initially configured, the Feature combination matrix must always be symmetric.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
86
Parent Item can only be added at the root.
Under Menus/Permission, the user tried to add a parent Item to nodes other than the root node.
Under Menus/Permission, ensure that the parent items can only be added at the root.

YES

Specific to “Menu Builder”87
Action Item cannot be added at the root, please select a destination Parent Item.
Under Menus/Permission, the user tried to add an action item under the root.
The action item must be added to it`s corresponding parent item, not to the root node.

YES

Specific to “Menu Builder”88
Action Item cannot be to another Action, please select a destination Parent Item.
Under Menus/Permission, the user tried to add an action item to another action item.
The action item must be added to it`s corresponding parent item.

YES

Specific to “Menu Builder”89
The imported workbook does not contain any valid worksheet.
The name of the worksheet was changed from “Defined Pattern Details” to some other value.
The name of the worksheet must be “Defined Pattern Details” while uploading the sheet into the pattern UI.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
Error is specific to “Defined Pattern”90
One or more target quantities for selected constraint are invalid, thus replaced with 0.
Non numerical data type was used in the quantity column of constraint UI.
Ensure that only numerical data type is entered for quantity while defining a Constraint.

YES

91
One or more target values for selected constraint are invalid.
The name of the target value does not match with those of attribute kits selected under the constraint.
The name of the target value must match with the values of the attribute kit, selected in the constraint definition.

YES

92
Invalid entry - plant name cannot be blank
The new plant name has been left blank while confirming the renaming plant.
Ensure that a New and unique plant name is entered in the "Add Plant" UI.

YES

93
Invalid entry - Plant name already in use
The new plant name is exactly the same as one of the existing plant name in the model.
Use a Unique Plant name that has not been used within the model.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
94
Error processing preassignment locks - assignment set {0} already exists
Newly defined PA set has the same name as a pre-existing PA Set in the scenario.
A new and unique name must be assigned to each new PA set created.

YES

95
The new process name cannot be blank.
The new process name has been left blank while confirming the rename process.
Ensure that a New and unique process name is entered in the "Rename Process" UI.

YES

96
The new process name is not unique within the production area.
The new process name is exactly the same as one of the existing process name in the production area.
Ensure that the New Process Name to be applied is unique within the production area.

YES

97
Syntax Error: 'From' clause not located - check for space after 'Select' clause
In a SQL query, the space between "from" and the previous/subsequent word is not maintained.
In a SQL query, ensure that a single space is maintained between "from" and its immediate neighbor.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
98
This query has a keyword ({0}) which is not allowed, please use SELECT queries only
The error is thrown in compound queries which start with "select" and has other keywords used within the SQL query.
In a SQL query, ensure that the following keywords are not used as part of the "select" payment: 
ALTER, CREATE, DELETE, DROP, MERGE, INSERT, RENAME, TRUNCATE, UPDATE.

YES

99
Syntax Error: executeQuery() statement must begin with 'select'
The keyword "select" was not used at the beginning of the SQL query.
Ensure that the SQL query typed in has "Select" at its beginning.

YES

100
Invalid bin names {0} found in the excel sheet uploaded.
Additional bins have been added in the constraint definition through Excel which are not defined in scenario.
Ensure that there is no additional bin defined in the constraint excel file. If such a bin is present, delete the bin from the file and upload.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
101
The number of target quantities for constraint {0} is {1}, the excess quantities in excel sheet have been ignored.
Additional identical bins were added in the constraint definition using Excel upload or existing bin was renamed.
Ensure that there is no additional identical bin defined in the constraint excel file. If such a bin is present, delete the bin from the file.
If an existing bin has been renamed, edit the name as per the convention noted in other columns

YES

102
One or more target quantities for constraint/s {0} are invalid, thus replaced with 0.
The ramping quantities for the bins has a alphanumeric value.
While the system will auto correct the value to 0%, ensure that the ramping values are correctly put in under ramping constraint.

YES

103
One or more target percentage values for constraint/s {0} are less than 0, thus replaced with 0.
The percentage ramping quantities for the bins has a value below 0%
While the system will auto correct the value to 0%, ensure that the ramping values are correctly put in under ramping constraint.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
104
One or more target percentage values for constraint/s {0} are greater than 100, thus replaced with 100.
The percentage ramping quantities for the bins has a value exceeding 100%
While the system will auto correct the value to 100%, ensure that the ramping values are correctly put in under ramping constraint.

YES

105
Invalid constraint(s) {0} found in the excel sheet.
Attempted definition of additional ramping constraint using excel file upload from the constraint table.
Define the new ramping constraint using the Constraint Summary UI.

NOT CLEAR106
Multiple tabs in the report have the same display label. This is not valid so please adjust the report configuration.
In report center, two or more tabs are having the same name and configuration selected.
In report center, make sure that no two tabs within the report configuration are exact copies of each other.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
107
There are no tabs defined for this report. Please adjust the report configuration.
In report center, no report tabs are configured for the Sales Data Analysis report.
In report center, ensure that the Sales Data Analysis report has the necessary tabs configured so that it can be generated without error.

YES

108
The routing code cannot be blank.
The routing code was left blank at the time of saving the route.
Add an appropriate routing code based on existing convention before saving the route.

YES

109
There was a duplicate line kit found the your list of line kits, please remove the dupe.
One of the routing has the same line kit added twice within its definition.
Under routing definition, either the duplicate line kit must be deselected or one of the line kits have to be re-defined.
Duplicate line kit found for this routing. Please verify the line kit

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
Dupe word can be changed since its an informal term110
The rate supplied for line {0}, must be greater than zero.
Under one of the routings, the value of the cycle time entered is "0".
Under the routing, ensure that the cycle time value is positive and greater than zero.

YES

111
The routing {0}, already exists in this scenario, please choose a different name.
The name of the newly defined route is same as a pre-existing route.
Rename the new route and make sure that the name is different compared to any pre-defined routes.

YES

112
The routing code contains invalid characters. Be aware that it can only use alphanumeric characters and underscores.
Special characters ( eg: ! @ # % & etc) were used in the proposed name of the route.
Make sure that the special characters are not used in the naming convention of routes.

YES

records.title: CORE
records.chunk:
113
The rate override for shift number {0}, of line {1}, must be greater than zero.
The duration of the shift override was not specified under one of the Routings.
- 
Ensure that the shift override is deselected before saving the route.
- 
If the override is necessary, make sure that the duration of the override is specified and not kept blank.

YES

114
Your routing must contain at least one line kit to be saved.
No line kit was assigned for the given routing.
The associated line kit must be added to the defined routing.

YES

115
This action could not be performed because either the scenario you are working in is locked or you do not have edit permissions for this production area.
The stated actions were carried out in a locked scenario or in an area with limited permissions for the user
Unlock the scenario and then try to carry out the necessary tasks or check with the admin and get required permissions

YES

{0}, Condition #{1} is incomplete. Please make sure that a value is specified for the right-hand-side of the expression.

-

YES

The usergroup {0} cannot be deleted as users are assigned to this group.

The User groups cannot be deleted if it already has users assigned to it. If it has to be deleted anyway, then under “Users”, unassign that particular User group.

YES

Total demand for zone {0} exceeds capacity: {1} vs {2}. Please adjust the capacity for the zone.
The capacity for the zone specified in the error is less than the demand.
The capacity for a zone has to be greater than or equal to the demand.

YES
